A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

customers.routes module¶

Customer Routes¶

This module defines the Flask routes for managing customer-related operations.

Blueprint:¶

  • customers_blueprint: Blueprint for customer-related APIs.

Routes:¶

  • POST /customer: Create a new customer.

  • PUT /customer/<username>: Update an existing customer’s information.

  • DELETE /customer/<username>: Delete a customer.

  • GET /customer/<username>: Fetch a customer’s details.

  • GET /customers: Fetch all customers.

  • POST /customer/<username>/wallet/charge: Charge an amount to a customer’s wallet.

  • POST /customer/<username>/wallet/deduct: Deduct an amount from a customer’s wallet.

customers.routes.charge_wallet(username)[source]¶

Charges an amount to a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Requires an Authorization token in the header to identify the user.

Expects a JSON payload with: - amount (float): The amount to charge.

Returns:

A success message or error if the customer is not found.

Return type:

Response (JSON)

customers.routes.create_customer()[source]¶

Registers a new customer.

Expects a JSON payload with: - full_name (str): The full name of the customer. - username (str): Unique username for the customer. - password (str): Password for the customer. - age (int): Age of the customer. - address (str, optional): Address of the customer. - gender (str, optional): Gender of the customer. - marital_status (str, optional): Marital status of the customer. - role (str, optional): Role of the user (“customer” or “admin”). Default is “customer”.

Returns:

A success message with a 201 status code or error message with appropriate status code.

Return type:

Response (JSON)

customers.routes.deduct_wallet(username)[source]¶

Deducts an amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Requires an Authorization token in the header to identify the user.

Expects a JSON payload with: - amount (float): The amount to deduct.

Returns:

A success message or error if the customer is not found or if insufficient funds.

Return type:

Response (JSON)

customers.routes.delete_customer(username)[source]¶

Deletes a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to delete.

Requires an Authorization token in the header to identify the user.

Returns:

A success message or error if the customer is not found.

Return type:

Response (JSON)

customers.routes.get_all_customers()[source]¶

Fetches all customers in the database.

Returns:

A list of all customer records.

Return type:

Response (JSON)

customers.routes.get_customer(username)[source]¶

Fetches customer details by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

The customer’s details or an error if not found.

Return type:

Response (JSON)

customers.routes.login()[source]¶
customers.routes.update_customer(username)[source]¶

Updates a customer’s information.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to update.

Requires an Authorization token in the header to identify the user.

Expects a JSON payload with any of the following fields: - full_name (str, optional) - password (str, optional) - age (int, optional) - address (str, optional) - gender (str, optional) - marital_status (str, optional) - wallet_balance (float, optional)

Returns:

A success message or error if the customer is not found.

Return type:

Response (JSON)
